dialogue.speaker: Rodion
dialogue.text: My name is Rodion Raskolnikov. I am a former student who lives in St. Petersburg.

dialogue.speaker: Rodion
dialogue.text: I am poor and I have committed a crime. I killed an old woman and her sister with an axe.

dialogue.speaker: Rodion
dialogue.text: I did it because I believed that I was an extraordinary man who was above the law.

dialogue.speaker: Police
dialogue.text: We have reason to believe that you are responsible for the murder of the pawnbroker and her sister.

dialogue.speaker: Rodion
dialogue.text: I did it. I killed them both.

dialogue.speaker: Rodion
dialogue.text: I did it because I believed that I was an extraordinary man who was above the law.

dialogue.speaker: Judge
dialogue.text: Rodion Raskolnikov, you have been found guilty of the murder of the pawnbroker and her sister.

dialogue.speaker: Judge
dialogue.text: Your sentence is eight years of hard labor in Siberia.

dialogue.speaker: Rodion
dialogue.text: I accept my punishment. I have realized that I was wrong to think that I was an extraordinary man.
